author: cheeky_gorilla
content:
Does the new data pricing mechanism for 4844 include priority fees? I understand that "data gas" is burned, but do blobs have priority fees that go to validators? If yes, will those priority fees get transferred to the execution layer to be paid out?

In the EIP I see "max_priority_fee_per_gas" within "BlobTransaction", but couldnt find additional info: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844#new-transaction-type

Asking because there's a question about this on Reddit!

author: protolambda
content: EIP-4844 does not add priority fees, because the transactions already have them, although the priority fee is expressed in terms  of ETH / gas and not ETH / data-gas. The same priority fee can be used to tip when publishing transactions with blobs.

author: cheeky_gorilla
content: Thanks Proto, so very high level, rollup sequencers will submit a transaction to a mainnet execution client as normal (with priority fees), but that transaction will also contain all the blob data which will be stored by consensus clients. Did I get that right?
